result.execSummary:
The defendant Chandler L Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education and obtain diploma, HSED or GED.  Obtain employment to extent of abilities.
Participate and comply with psychiatric medical treatment, including attending appointments with therapist and taking prescribed medications.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Complete domestic violence class.  Comply with all Family Court orders.  May not live with current girlfriend without approval of agent and defendant's mother.  Establish paternity on child due in August.  There must be a specific visitation schedule established.  Do not drive without valid driver's license.  Take steps necessary to obtain driver's license.  Complete anger management and other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Enroll in the Fatherhood Initiative Program and join a father's group at church.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
